html:
I'm Indragie Karunaratne.

I've been fascinated by technology and electronics since early childhood. This is the timeline of the milestones in my life that have lead me to where I am today.
Grade 4 (2004): Took my first programming class building software in HyperCard on a Mac Plus
Grade 9 (2009): Started learning Objective-C on my new MacBook Pro by reading Cocoa Programming for Mac OS X by Aaron Hillegass
Grade 10 (2010): Built my first big app in Objective-C, a task management app for the first iPad — unreleased
Grade 11 (2011): Released Sonora, a beautiful audio player for OS X and my first commercially successful app
September 2012: Entered the Computer Engineering program at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, AB
Summer 2012: Interned at Amazon in Seattle, WA. Worked on a complete overhaul of the native Cloud Drive client for OS X
Fall 2013: Released Flamingo, a modern instant messaging client for OS X designed with fresh ideas from the ground up
